content: version 2 now with written instructions stashbuster blarf blanket + scarf = blarf the stashbuster blarf is a large-­ sized packable and cozy scarf that can be used as a light blanket in a pinch the pattern is designed to use up all those delicious little balls of leftover yarn that we can t bear to get rid of this design offers wide latitude for improvisation depending in the amount and type of yarn at hand and your own tastes and preferences 1 i used a 5mm hook and blocked aggressively to achieve a lacy drape the following are broad guidelines and suggestions followed by specific line by line instructions followed by charts guidelines and suggestions recommended yarn assemble a pile of small to medium balls of leftover yarn in complementary colors the yarn weight texture and material can vary to create visual interest the blarf featured in these photographs utilizes a combination of fingering dk and sport weight yarns in a mixture of cotton wool and linen some of the yarns are silky some are stiff others are fuzzy structure the blarf design is comprised of three tranches 1 the body which is comprised of four linear motifs repeated over and over 2 the border which is optional 2 3 the fringe which is also optional because some people don t like fringes gauge is not important you should strive to make your blarf long enough to wrap around your body and then some my rule of thumb is to strive for a length that is about 6 inches longer than the distance between your fingertips when your arms are outstretched i like my width be at least 2 feet if you intend to add a 3 inch border all around which would add 6 inches to both the length and width reduce the size of the body accordingly also remember that blocking will increased the size here s how you do a dc3 cluster *yo insert hook in next double_crochet yo pull up a loop yo draw through two stitches leaving remaining stitches on hook repeat * twice more end stitch by drawing through remaining 4 loops on hook 3 instructions for body 1 make a foundation chain at least as long as your outstretched arms in multiples of 2 plus 1 ch3 to turn 2 double_crochet in fourth chain of foundation row ch1 skip 1 chain below dc1 repeat to the last chain of foundation dc1 ch3 to turn 3 the linear motifs are as follows see chart on following page a linear motif 1 fat wall this is simply a row of double_crochet across ch1 to turn b linear motif 2 mesh i line 1 sc1 in double_crochet twice * ch3 skip 2 dcs sc1 in next double_crochet * repeat ** to last double_crochet sc1 in last double_crochet ch1 to turn ii
